text:
Orlando Science Center named finalist for national service honor Orlando Science Center Roberto Gonzalez / Orlando Science Center Orlando Science Center is a 2017 finalist for National Medal for Museum and Library Service. The award will be announced later this spring. Orlando Science Center is a 2017 finalist for National Medal for Museum and Library Service. The award will be announced later this spring. (Roberto Gonzalez / Orlando Science Center) Dewayne Bevil Caption Epcot Flower & Garden Fest goes geometric with new ear style 
Minnie Mouse and Figment are featured in the Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival's new headband. Steve Miller, merchandise communications manager, discusses the geometric style used to create the artwork on this popular item. 
Minnie Mouse and Figment are featured in the Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival's new headband. Minnie Mouse and Figment are featured in the Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival's new headband. Steve Miller, merchandise communications manager, discusses the geometric style used to create the artwork on this popular item. 
Minnie Mouse and Figment are featured in the Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival's new headband. Steve Miller, merchandise communications manager, discusses the geometric style used to create the artwork on this popular item. Caption Universal brings 30 Rock to life with Jimmy Fallon ride 
Jason Surrell, creative director at Universal Creative, explains how the façade for the building that houses the new ride 'Race Through New York Starring Jimmy Fallon' resembles New York City landmark 30 Rockefeller Center. The art deco structure is home to the Studio 6B, where the ‘Tonight Show’ is taped. 
Jason Surrell, creative director at Universal Creative, explains how the façade for the building that houses the new ride 'Race Through New York Starring Jimmy Fallon' resembles New York City landmark 30 Rockefeller Center. The art deco structure is home to the Studio 6B, where the ‘Tonight Show’ is taped. Caption For St Patrick's Day weekend: Ireland's favorite boy band lands at Disney Springs 
Meet the Byrne Brothers, three boys from Donegal, Ireland, that will be featured performers at Raglan Road Irish Pub’s ‘Mighty Festival’ at Disney Springs through St. Patrick’s Day weekend. The brothers, ages 13, 10 & 7, became an international sensation after a performance in their hometown last year went viral. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) 
Meet the Byrne Brothers, three boys from Donegal, Ireland, that will be featured performers at Raglan Road Irish Pub’s ‘Mighty Festival’ at Disney Springs through St. Patrick’s Day weekend. The brothers, ages 13, 10 & 7, became an international sensation after a performance in their hometown last year went viral. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) Caption Disneyland cracks down on parade seat savers — will Disney World follow? — Orlando News Now 
At Disneyland, folks will not be allowed to set up camp for the high-demand spots until parade set-up begins. And even then, park guests won’t be able to hold spots for friends who are gallivanting elsewhere in the park. A policy change hasn’t happened at Disney World. The problem just isn’t as prevalent in Florida, Disney World says.

The problem just isn’t as prevalent in Florida, Disney World says. Caption Water park competition heats up with Volcano Bay - Orlando News Now 
When it opens May 25, Volcano Bay — which will send visitors plunging through a waterfall and drifting through a starlit cavern — is expected to have ripple effects throughout Central Florida. It could take market share from other theme parks’ water playgrounds, at least for a while.
